turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Bellarine, Victoria.
turn.1: What are the main economic activities in Bellarine, Victoria?
turn.2: Bellarine Post Office closed on 27 April 1979, and Bellarine Primary School has also closed; its closure date is unknown, but the site has been subdivided and sold.
turn.3: What are the major land marks in the area?
turn.4: The "Avondale" residence, which was the former "Farmers' Arms Hotel", survives, as does the former Wesleyan Methodist Church and the Methodist Sunday School and Church Hall (now the Uniting Church Hall).
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Spray Farm, a historic rural property and one of the earliest farms on the Bellarine Peninsula, is located at Bellarine.
turn.7: Is there anything of importance at the farm?
turn.8: It dates from 1851 and is listed on the Victorian Heritage Register and the Register of the National Estate.
turn.9: Is it open to the public?
turn.10: The property was bought in 1994 by the Browne family, owners of the adjacent Scotchman's Hill Vineyard, who renovated the property in 1998 and operated it as a function centre and concert venue.
turn.11: What types of concerts are held there?
turn.12: Among many concerts held there during this period, Spray Farm hosted the major Day on the Green music festival for nine years.
